instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B After water damage clean doesnt switch on from Power Button
threads.message:
Hi,

Board had a slight water damage. Cleaned it in utrasonic. Evertything seems to be working except for switching it on with power button (the button works). To turn it on I have to disconnect battery and MAgsafe adapter. When reconnect magsafe it turns on again and works normally. If I shut it down I can switch it on again with power button. I have to reconnect magsafe. If I press power button the light on magsafe goes to green and then back to orange (like during smc reset) but macbook doesnt switch on. If I press power button while OS is ON it immediately switches macbook OFF. I wonder what can it be... hmmm. Please help.

Thank you!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B After water damage clean doesnt switch on from Power Button
threads.message:
Short inside of the keyboard's ground to <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> most likely

Monitor the voltage of <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> when pressing the button, it shouldn't fluctuate more then 0.02v at best.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B After water damage clean doesnt switch on from Power Button
threads.message: You have tried a new keyboard right ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B After water damage clean doesnt switch on from Power Button
threads.message: So the power button is causing an SMC reset. This will be either a trackpad issue or the trackpad cable/connector. My bet is the trackpad.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B After water damage clean doesnt switch on from Power Button
threads.message:
Halleluja! Gave a trackpad connector another manual clean and replaced a cable and voil√†! power button is working like a power button again instead of CMS button :D

Thank you all!
